Bash(python -c "
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from jose import jwt
from backend.config import settings

def generate_token_for_user\(user_id: str\):
    payload = {
        ''sub'': user_id,
        ''name'': f''User {user_id}'',
        ''email'': f''{user_id}@example.com'',
        ''exp'': datetime.utcnow\(\) + timedelta\(days=30\)
    }
    token = jwt.encode\(payload, settings.jwt_secret, algorithm=settings.jwt_algorithm\)
    return token

user_id = ''user-1767566499606''
token = generate_token_for_user\(user_id\)

print\(f''Generated token for user: {user_id}''\)
print\(f''Token: {token}''\)
print\(\)
print\(''To use this token in the browser console:''\)
print\(f''localStorage.setItem\(\\''auth_token\\'', \\''{token}\\''\);''\)
print\(f''localStorage.setItem\(\\''user_id\\'', \\''{user_id}\\''\);''\)
print\(f''localStorage.setItem\(\\''user_email\\'', \\''{user_id}@example.com\\''\);''\)
")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Revert API URL configuration to include /api prefix

- Correct the base URL to include /api suffix as endpoints are mounted at /api/*
- This allows the frontend to properly access /api/auth/generate-token endpoint
- The router prefix in main.py adds /api to all routes, so frontend needs to account for it
- Reverts previous change that caused 405/404 errors on token generation

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
